fr.upmc.components.interfaces

Interface TwoWayI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentImplementedI, OfferedI, java.rmi.Remote, RequiredI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataTwoWayConnectorI, DataTwoWayI, DataTwoWayI.PullI, DataTwoWayI.PushI, DataTwoWayPortI, PairedGaugeI, TwoWayConnectorI, TwoWayPortI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataTwoWayConnector, AbstractDataTwoWayPort, AbstractTwoWayConnector, AbstractTwoWayPort, DataTwoWayConnector, PairedGaugeConnector, PairedGaugePort

    public interface TwoWayI
extends RequiredI, OfferedI
    The interface TwoWayI is meant to represent symmetric interfaces connecting two components that can play both the role of clients and server towards each others.

    Description

    Basically, a two way interface can be seen as both a required and an offered interface. The symmetry in the definition eases the connection and the calls between the two components.

    Created on : 2012-01-23
